TopicTitle: Ship just dissapeared during a launch test.

Articles.Content:
Exploring the idea of recoverable stages, I had a ship with 3 radial stages with parachutes on. Once the stages burnt out I jetisoned them, with the parachutes deployed. I then continued with the launch, keeping an eye on the stages. Then they dissapeared. I wondered if I didn't have enough parachutes on and they had all exploded on impact. So I relaunch and this time after jetisoning them I focus on them instead of the ship. The ship had plenty of fuel, it should have kept going for a while. On impact the stages survive no problems, but when I go into map view the main ship is gone. Just like the stages were before. Persistent debris is set to 250. The game auto saved, so now Jeb and Bill are just gone, they are not in the crew roster under any of the tabs or anything ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

KSP V1.0.2.842

Screenshot: [http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=451972134](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=451972134)

This is no bug. Your game is behaving **exactly** as it should.

KSP has a 'physics bubble'. Anything beyond about 22 km from your current object is put 'on rails', physics is no longer calculated for those objects and continue on a fixed trajectory. Any object on rails in an atmosphere below a certain altitude (for Kerbin that's roughly 23km) is deleted as it is considered to burn up or crash.

Mods like [StageRecovery](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86677-1-0-2-StageRecovery-Recover-Funds-from-Dropped-Stages-v1-5-6-%285-15-15%29) allow you to recover funds from dropped boosters and stages.
